intro: Leichhardtia parva, commonly known as the dwarf leichhardtia, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in racemes, and it is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its delicate appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
